meanings.definition: A variety of apple with a greenish-yellow skin.
meanings.sent1: I picked a juicy codlin from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The market sells fresh codlins every autumn.
meanings.sent3: The codlin rolled off the table and into the basket.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a ripe codlin in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The sweet fragrance of the codlin filled the room.

meanings.definition: A young or small cod fish.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen caught a tiny codlin in the shallow waters.
meanings.sent2: The aquarium has a tank dedicated to showcasing codlins.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seal chased the codlin playfully.
meanings.sent4: The codlin swam gracefully, like a dancer in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The little codlin darted among the rocks, seeking shelter.
